case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances: Skeletal remains were located by hikers 1.5 miles northeast of the intersection at Equestrian Drive and Foothills Drive. There was an apparent campsite located in the area with numerous personal items.
case_head_hair: Estimated to be around 7 inches long at time of death
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_with_body:
Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered: 
Grey jacket "David Taylor" size M, 
a blue short sleeve "Umbro" t-shirt size L
case_eyewear:
Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered:
a "Wal-Mart" glasses case with 2 pairs of prescription eyeglasses
case_other_items_with_body:
Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered:
a black "Skyway" canvas bag that contained a "Realistic" walkman tape player with headphones, the glasses listed above, and a silver "M. Hohner Blues Harp" harmonica. A black "Aqualite" wrist watch with a black plastic band was also found in the area. Numerous bottles (some full, some empty) of aspirin and sleep aid was also found.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
